item.title: Mutually Recursive Prime Functions
item.description: In the previous post I talked about what recursion is, what it takes for a number to be prime, and how we can apply recursion to the problem of primality testing and prime factorisation. In this post we’ll take the next logical step: finding primes in a sea of integers. Hunting for Primes So, after the work we did in the previous post, we now have two functions that depend on each other to work at all; but we can do better.

item.title: Mutually Recursive Prime Functions
item.description: OK, I admit it… I love prime numbers. I don’t know why, but I know I’m not alone. There’s just something about them. Maybe it’s their indivisible nature – their atomicity – that seems so appealing. Maybe it’s the fact that they’re well understood, but nevertheless intangible – there’s no equation for finding primes and most of our methods for finding them involve brute-force. Anyway, whatever it is, I just love them and I love writing code to generate them.
